text:
When generating requests, jmeter adds the port to the http request string--
even it the port is port 80.

Example:
http://www.netflix.com:80/Default

Jmeter shouldn't add the port to http targets operating on the default port 80.
creator: mjuliana@netflix.com
mstover1@apache.org
text:
Not sure why this would be a problem, but it's changed so the port is not
included if it is port 80 or not set by user.

creator: mjuliana@netflix.com
text:
Hi Mike-

This was an issue for me as we have our servers running behind a load balancer.  The load balancer is listening on port 80 but the servers are listening on port 7001.

The server responds differently if the URL includes a port number.  Since requests to the default port (80) don't need to include port number I thought I'd log it as a bug to see if you'd fix it.

Thanks for fixing it--it will make our testing easier.  BTW, we really like and use Jmeter here in the Netflix QA department.
